title: NASA gets its mojo back with a stunning nighttime launch of the SLS rocket
content:
KENNEDY SPACE CENTER, Fla.â€”The skies were auspicious during the wee hours of Wednesday morning, as the Artemis I mission ticked down its final seconds until liftoff.

Ten, nine, eight seconds ...

Shining brightly, near the southern horizon, was the constellation Orion, namesake to NASA's new deep space vehicle.
